intro: Dasylirion longissimum var. treleasei, commonly known as the Trelease's sotol, is a perennial plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of long, narrow, bluish-green leaves that can grow up to several feet in length. The plant produces a tall, branched inflorescence bearing small, white to greenish flowers in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to drought conditions and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a notable species in desert botany.
